results.headline: Review: ‘Thank You for Your Service,’ Stories of Soldiers and Suicide
results.summary_short: This documentary spotlights the lack of support for combat veterans struggling with mental health problems and the tragic consequences of that neglect.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Thank You for Your Service

results.headline: Review: ‘The Unspoken’: If You Move Here, Find a Realtor Fast
results.summary_short: This thriller features a creaky building where something eerie once happened, and where Jodelle Ferland plays the nanny to a boy who has just moved in.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Unspoken

results.headline: Review: Another Look at Donald Trump’s Scottish Dealings
results.summary_short: “You’ve Been Trumped Too,” from Anthony Baxter, follows up on what happened to residents of Balmedie after Mr. Trump built a golf resort there.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of You’ve Been Trumped Too

results.headline: Review: In ‘Supersonic,’ the Band Oasis and Its Combative Brothers
results.summary_short: This documentary looks at the rock group’s founding members, Liam and Noel Gallagher, through older footage and animated re-creations.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Supersonic

results.headline: Review: 500 Years of Cultivation in ‘Portrait of a Garden’
results.summary_short: A Dutch kitchen garden on a historic estate yields lessons about what humans and nature can cooperate in creating.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Portrait of a Garden

results.headline: Review: ‘Boo! A Madea Halloween’ Finds Tyler Perry in the Usual Costume(s)
results.summary_short: Mr. Perry’s most popular character is back again to crack wise and deliver advice in this comedy. He plays some other people, too.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Boo! A Madea Halloween

results.headline: ‘Fire at Sea’ Is Not the Documentary You’d Expect About the Migrant Crisis. It’s Better.
results.summary_short: Instead of raising awareness, Gianfranco Rosi cultivates alertness. His film is an impressionistic tour of an Italian island turned upside down.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fire at Sea

results.headline: Review: ‘The Handmaiden’ Explores Confinement in Rich, Erotic Textures
results.summary_short: This erotic fantasy from Park Chan-wook, set in Korea in the 1930s, tries to ravish your senses so thoroughly you may not notice its sleights of hand.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Handmaiden

results.headline: Review: In ‘Creepy,’ a Cold Case Turns Red Hot, but Don’t Tell the Neighbors
results.summary_short: Kiyoshi Kurosawa’s movie, blends elements of a detective story, horror film, domestic drama and psychological thriller to create a kind of existential dread.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Creepy

results.headline: Review: In ‘Ouija: Origin of Evil,’ a Youngster Who Nails ‘Creepy’
results.summary_short: In this prequel to “Ouija,” Lulu Wilson delivers chills as a girl with a psychic link to a malevolent board game.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ouija: Origin of Evil

results.headline: Review: ‘A Stray’ and a Muslim in Search of Acceptance
results.summary_short: This Musa Syeed drama, starring Barkhad Abdirahman, is set in Minneapolis and shows why Mr. Syeed the storyteller is on the rise.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Stray

results.headline: ‘Moonlight’: Is This the Year’s Best Movie?
results.summary_short: Our critic A.O. Scott says this film about a young black man’s coming of age is both a disarmingly personal film and an urgent social document.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Moonlight

results.headline: Review: Tom Cruise Has a Familiar Furrow in ‘Jack Reacher: Never Go Back’
results.summary_short: Mr. Cruise returns as this title character to fight menace in Edward Zwick’s film.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jack Reacher: Never Go Back

results.headline: Review: ‘American Pastoral,’ Philip Roth’s Fiery 1960s at Low Heat
results.summary_short: Ewan McGregor’s directorial debut is a shallow but watchable gloss on this Roth novel, conjuring a searing image of the disintegrating American dream.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of American Pastoral

results.headline: Review: Don’t Mess With the Dog in ‘In a Valley of Violence’
results.summary_short: A mysterious stranger rides into a decaying mining town with horse and collie. He didn’t mean to kick up trouble.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of In a Valley of Violence

results.headline: Review: ‘Keeping Up With the Joneses’ Might Not Be Worth It
results.summary_short: This film about a spy couple has star power in Jon Hamm, but utilitarian construction and a lack of chemistry are downfalls.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Keeping Up With The Joneses

results.headline: Review: It’s Pornographer vs. Pornographer in ‘King Cobra’
results.summary_short: Mr. Slater’s and Mr. Franco’s characters try to out-sleaze each other in this low-budget dark comedy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of King Cobra

results.headline: Review: ‘It Had to Be You’ Is a Witty Rom-Com With a 1950s Feel
results.summary_short: Cristin Milioti plays an ambivalent woman weighing commitment in this film with a throwback touch.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of It Had To Be You

results.headline: Review: Rob Zombie’s ‘31’ Traffics in Gore and Bad Taste
results.summary_short: Instead of spoofing 1970s horror classics, this film goes overboard in trying to outdo them.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 31

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Uncondemned,’ Rwandan Rape Survivors Seek Justice
results.summary_short: Facing an uphill battle, a small legal team puts a former Rwandan mayor on trial for his role in encouraging and ordering rapes during the country’s 1994 genocide.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Uncondemned
